intro: Microseris douglasii subsp. platycarpha, commonly known as the broadleaf sulfurflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are basal, linear, and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The subspecies is distinguished by its broader leaves and more robust growth compared to other members of the species.
